title: U.K. Labour strategists advise Harris on winning from the center left
content: After Keir Starmer led the Labour Party to a big win in July’s election, U.K. strategists say they have relevant insights to share with Kamala Harris’s campaign.
summary: After Keir Starmer led the Labour Party to a big win in July’s election, U.K. strategists say they have relevant insights to share with Kamala Harris’s campaign.

title: How Mexico is helping Biden and Harris at the U.S. border
content: A major reason for the drop in apprehensions at the border this year: Mexico is stopping migrants well before they reach the border.
summary: A major reason for the drop in apprehensions at the border this year: Mexico is stopping migrants well before they reach the border.

title: Four Islamic State leaders killed in August raid in Iraq, U.S. says
content: Military officials said those killed in a dramatic mission by U.S. and Iraqi forces last month included the extremist group’s head of operations in Iraq.
summary: Military officials said those killed in a dramatic mission by U.S. and Iraqi forces last month included the extremist group’s head of operations in Iraq.

title: Russia expels U.K. diplomats; Putin warns against deep strikes with Western weapons
content: The Russian president issued his sternest warning to date about the use of Western weapons in Ukraine ahead of a meeting of British and U.S. leaders.
summary: The Russian president issued his sternest warning to date about the use of Western weapons in Ukraine ahead of a meeting of British and U.S. leaders.

title: Pope Francis says Harris and Trump are ‘against life’
content: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris’s immigration and abortion stances drew a stern response from Pope Francis, who advised Catholics in the U.S. to choose the “lesser evil.”
summary: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris’s immigration and abortion stances drew a stern response from Pope Francis, who advised Catholics in the U.S. to choose the “lesser evil.”

title: U.S. says Russian state media outlet runs intelligence operations
content: The State Department accuses RT, the Russian media outlet, of running intelligence operations and procuring weapons for the war in Ukraine.
summary: The State Department accuses RT, the Russian media outlet, of running intelligence operations and procuring weapons for the war in Ukraine.

title: Zelensky said his victory plan will lead to ‘reliable peace’ in Ukraine
content: Without revealing more details, Zelensky once again talked about the plan he will bring to President Joe Biden on how to end the war with Russia.
summary: Without revealing more details, Zelensky once again talked about the plan he will bring to President Joe Biden on how to end the war with Russia.

title: North Korea reveals uranium site as Kim Jong Un demands more nuclear weapons
content: The North Korean leader called for stronger efforts to “exponentially increase” the number of nuclear weapons in the country.
summary: The North Korean leader called for stronger efforts to “exponentially increase” the number of nuclear weapons in the country.

title: Eiffel’s descendants say ‘non’ to keeping Olympic rings on Eiffel Tower
content: The Paris mayor wants the Olympic logo to stay on the monument. Gustave Eiffel’s descendants say the tower shouldn’t be a permanent billboard.
summary: The Paris mayor wants the Olympic logo to stay on the monument. Gustave Eiffel’s descendants say the tower shouldn’t be a permanent billboard.

title: Russian counteroffensive in Ukrainian-controlled Kursk begins, says Zelensky
content: Zelensky said that the Russian counteroffensive had long been expected and was planned for.
summary: Zelensky said that the Russian counteroffensive had long been expected and was planned for.

title: Kyiv’s bombed children’s hospital rebuilds, and one boy heads home
content: Hundreds with severe medical needs were displaced by July’s missile strike on Okhmatdyt Children’s Hospital in Kyiv, but the hospital was rebuilt and many returned.
summary: Hundreds with severe medical needs were displaced by July’s missile strike on Okhmatdyt Children’s Hospital in Kyiv, but the hospital was rebuilt and many returned.

title: A new crisis may plunge Libya back into chaos
content: The recent dramas gripping the country have been shadowy, shaped by backroom deals, black market transfers and illicit smuggling.
summary: The recent dramas gripping the country have been shadowy, shaped by backroom deals, black market transfers and illicit smuggling.

title: Is the new statue of the late Queen Elizabeth II really that ... bad?
content: The newly unveiled sculpture at Antrim Castle Gardens in Northern Ireland was compared online to Robin Williams’s character in the 1993 movie “Mrs. Doubtfire.”
summary: The newly unveiled sculpture at Antrim Castle Gardens in Northern Ireland was compared online to Robin Williams’s character in the 1993 movie “Mrs. Doubtfire.”

title: Afghan women defy Taliban and continue medical school in Scotland
content: The Scottish government granted free tuition to female students from Afghanistan to continue studying medicine after the Taliban upended their education.
summary: The Scottish government granted free tuition to female students from Afghanistan to continue studying medicine after the Taliban upended their education.

title: U.N. agency says six of its staff among those killed in Israeli strikes
content: The workers were killed when two airstrikes hit a Gaza refugee camp, said UNRWA, the U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees. Israel said it targeted Hamas militants.
summary: The workers were killed when two airstrikes hit a Gaza refugee camp, said UNRWA, the U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees. Israel said it targeted Hamas militants.

title: Gaza’s traumatized children are facing another lost year of school
content: About 650,000 students are missing their second school year, an absence educators say will compound the trauma of war and could cause lasting developmental problems.
summary: About 650,000 students are missing their second school year, an absence educators say will compound the trauma of war and could cause lasting developmental problems.
